sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"愉快的，高兴的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: happy, glad, cheerful, joyful, merry, delightful, gay, pleasant, nice, jolly, agreeable
means: happy ： 侧重感到满足、幸福或高兴。
glad ： 最普通用词，语气较弱，表示礼貌的惯用语。指乐于做某事或因某事而感到满足，常表愉快的心情。
cheerful ： 多指因内心的愉快而表现出兴高采烈，是强调而自然的感情流露。
joyful ： 语气较强，强调心情或感情上的欣喜。
merry ： 指精神情绪的暂时高涨，表示欢乐、愉快的心境或情景，侧重充满欢笑声和乐趣。
delightful ： 指能带来强烈的快乐，激起愉快的情感，用于非常愉快的场合。
gay ： 侧重无忧无虑、精神昂扬、充满生命的快乐。
pleasant ： 侧重给人以"赏心悦目"或"愉快的，宜人的"感受。
nice ： 语气较温和，泛指任何愉快或满意的感觉。
jolly ： 通俗用词，多指充满快乐与喜悦的神情。
agreeable ： 指与感受者的愿望、情趣或受好等和谐一致而带来的心情上的快意。

sentence.Network_en: I just wanted to wish you a merry Christmas.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只想祝福你圣诞快乐。

sentence.Network_en: The phantom of the merry-go-round is just a local superstition.
sentence.Network_cn: 旋转木马的幽灵只不过是当地的迷信说法。

sentence.Network_en: It hasn't stopped the British Navy proceeding on its merry way.
sentence.Network_cn: 这没有阻止英国海军继续得意扬扬地前进的步伐。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)carry on with a course of action regardless of the consequences
enjoy oneself with others by dancing and drinking
the more people or things there are, the better a situation will be
jx.jx_cn_mean: 人（或物）越多越快乐，人（或物）越多越好

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English myrige 'pleasing, delightful', of Germanic origin; related to mirth

entry.tran: 欢乐的;愉快的;兴高采烈的
entry.def: If you describe someone's character or behaviour as merry, you mean that they are happy and cheerful.

example.ex: He was much loved for his merry nature...
example.tran: 他快乐的天性很是招人喜欢。

example.ex: From the house come the bursts of merry laughter...
example.tran: 房子里传出一阵阵欢乐的笑声。

entry.tran: (声音)悦耳的;(景象)令人快乐的
entry.def: A merry sound or sight makes you feel cheerful.

example.ex: ...the merry sounds of a seven-piece brass band...
example.tran: 由7名乐手组成的铜管乐队演奏的悦耳乐声

example.ex: She was humming a merry little tune.
example.tran: 她哼着一支动听的小曲。

entry.def: If you get merry, you get slightly drunk.

example.ex: They went off to Glengarriff to get merry.
example.tran: 他们到格伦加里夫去好好地喝上一杯。

entry.tran: (表示强调，常有不赞成或幽默之意)
entry.def: Some people use merry to emphasize something that they are saying, often when they want to express disapproval or humour.

example.ex: It hasn't stopped the British Navy proceeding on its merry way...
example.tran: 这没有阻止英国海军继续得意扬扬地前进的步伐。

example.ex: In the merry world of American lawyers it is the simplest thing in the world to start an action.
example.tran: 在无忧无虑的美国律师界，世上最简单的事情就是提出诉讼。

entry.def: Just before Christmas and on Christmas Day, people say 'Merry Christmas' to other people to express the hope that they will have a happy time.

example.ex: I just wanted to wish you a merry Christmas...
example.tran: 我只想祝福你圣诞快乐。

entry.def: If people make merry, they enjoy themselves and have fun, for example by singing, dancing, and drinking together.

example.ex: Neighbours approached their boundaries from opposite sides and made merry together.
example.tran: 邻居们从对面来到他们这边，一起尽情欢乐。

means.word_mean: 1. full of or showing high-spirited merriment;

sentences.sentence: "a poet could not but be gay, in such a jocund company"- Wordsworth

sentences.cn: 我们加入了兴高采烈的人群中。

sentences.en: I was already merry after only two glasses of wine.
sentences.cn: 我只喝了两杯酒就有点醉了。

jushi.english: They were in a very merry mood.

jushi.chinese: 我们加入了兴高采烈的人群中。

jushi.english: After the examination, he went home at a merry pace.
jushi.chinese: 考完试后,他迈着轻快的步伐回家了。
